Berin,

This is a pretty comprehensive set of questions, and a reminder tha=
t
JUnit has grown well beyond the feature set covered by any overview
docum=
entation that I'm aware of.
Assembling a complete set of answers is probabl=
y the work of
weeks--are there high-priority questions that we can answer i=
n the
meantime?  Thanks,

   David Saff

On Mon, Feb 1, 2010 at 1:07 PM, Lo=
ritsch, Berin C.
<berin.loritsch@...> wrote:
> Some of the annotatio=
ns are pretty well understood and map directly to
> JUnit 3 concepts, so I'=
ll just keep them here for completeness:
>
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @Test - run this=
 method as a test
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @Ignore - do not run this test for now
> =
* =A0 =A0 =A0 @Before - set up data for the next test
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @Afte=
r - tear down data for the next test
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @BeforeClass - set up =
supporting classes for this suite of tests
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @AfterClass - te=
ar down supporting classes for this suite of
> tests
>
> After that is a wh=
ole bunch of annotations that are quite new to me and
> I'm trying to under=
stand when, where, and how to use them:
>
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @Rule - Mark a te=
st attribute that extends MethodRule to affect
> the test outcome (more adv=
anced verifications)
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @Category - Mark tests or test classes=
 as belonging to a
> category, which is used with specific test suites. =A0=
Not sure how this
> works when you are invoking the tests through a build s=
ystem. =A0For
> example, turn off slow tests until we do integration etc. =
=A0At least it
> is marked.
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @RunWith(Runner.class) - Run a =
test suite with a particular
> runner. =A0Enables other things like theorie=
s to work
>
> Theories: thanks for the blog entry, it helps. =A0Are these m=
eant to
> verify an algorithm with several datapoints? =A0If not, what othe=
r uses
> were they designed for?
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @DataPoint - used with the=
ories, marks a test attribute as data
> to pass in to parameterized tests
>=
 * =A0 =A0 =A0 @DataPoints - used with theories, marks a test attribute tha=
t is
> a collection as data to pass in to parameterized tests? =A0Pure gues=
s
> here.
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @ParametersSuppliedBy(ParameterSupplier.class) - =
used with
> theories, maps datapoints to the theory tests? =A0Pure guess he=
re.
> * =A0 =A0 =A0 @Theory - marks a parameterized test that is executed s=
everal
> times to include all applicable combinations of datapoints
> * =A0=
 =A0 =A0 @TestedOn - not sure about its applicability.
>
> Parameterized: r=
un tests with a list of parameters. =A0The List of
> parameters is specifie=
d by the @Parameters method.
>
> Suites: run a suite of tests. =A0The set o=
f classes is marked by
> @SuiteClasses.
>

ssage have been removed]
